newsitem.title: USA: U.S. debt futures finish strong in short session.
newsitem.headline: U.S. debt futures finish strong in short session.

text.p: U.S. debt futures rallied in a shortened holiday session and closed strong, with December Treasury bonds achieving the highest price since February.
A bid early in the market was tied to Japanese buying interest overnight and firm foreign fixed-income markets.

Traders said a drop in the American Production and Inventory Control Society (APICS) manufacturing index for November aided gains. The APICS business outlook index fell to 46.8 in November from 49.1 in October.
Traders noted buy-stops above 116-00 in December and said technical momentum extended the move.
December climbed to the highest price since February at 116-11/32, exceeding resistance at Tuesday's high of 116-05/32.
Bond futures at the Chicago Board of Trade finished at 1210 CST/1810 GMT, while Eurodollar futures at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange closed at 1200 CST.

"Sentiment down here on the floor is very very bullish," said Kurt Fraim, futures analyst with Aubrey G. Lanston. "It's been a long time since I've seen even the locals this bulled up. We had a good steady bid all day long."
